ProfilePropertySettingsCollection Class

Definition

Contains a set of ProfilePropertySettingsCollection objects.

In this Article

[System.Configuration.ConfigurationCollection(typeof(System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings))]
public class ProfilePropertySettingsCollection : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Remarks

The profile section of the configuration file specifies a schema for user profiles. At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the profile section to generate a class called ProfileCommon, which is derived from ProfileBase. The ProfileCommon class definition is based on the properties defined in the properties subsection of the profile section of the configuration file. An instance of this class is created for each user profile, and you can access the individual profile values in your code through the Profile property. For more information about profile properties, see ASP.NET Profile Properties Overview. For more information about the profile features added to ASP.NET 2.0, see ASP.NET Profile Properties Overview.

Methods

Add(ProfilePropertySettings)

public void Add (System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings propertySettings);
propertySettings
ProfilePropertySettings

A ProfilePropertySettings object to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

The ProfilePropertySettings object to add already exists in the collection or the collection is read only.

Remarks

The collection must not already contain a ProfilePropertySettings object with the same name.

Clear()

Removes all ProfilePropertySettings objects from the collection.

public void Clear ();

Remarks

This method inserts a clear directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.

OnDeserializeUnrecognizedElement(String,XmlReader)

Handles the reading of unrecognized configuration elements from a configuration file and causes the configuration system to throw an exception if the element cannot be handled.

protected override bool OnDeserializeUnrecognizedElement (string elementName, System.Xml.XmlReader reader);
elementName
String

The name of the unrecognized element.

reader
XmlReader

An input stream that reads XML from the configuration file.

Returns
Boolean

true if the unrecognized element was deserialized successfully; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ConfigurationErrorsException

elementName equals "clear"

- or -

elementName equals "group".

Remarks

This implementation of OnDeserializeUnrecognizedElement throws specialized errors if the element name is either "clear" or "group". After checking for these conditions, the method then explicitly calls its base implementation, the OnDeserializeUnrecognizedElement method.

Removes a ProfilePropertySettings object from the collection.

public void Remove (string name);

String

The name of a ProfilePropertySettings object to remove from the collection.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

There is no ProfilePropertySettings object with the specified key in the collection.

- or -

The element has already been removed.

- or -

The collection is read-only.

Remarks

This method inserts a remove element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

public void Set (System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings propertySettings);

ProfilePropertySettings

A ProfilePropertySettings object.

Exceptions
ConfigurationException

The ProfilePropertySettings object to add already exists in the collection, or the collection is read-only.

Remarks

Calling this method has the same effect as calling the Add method.
